references.paper_title: Dream to control: Learning behaviors by latent imagination
references.reason: This paper introduces the core methodology of model-based RL in imagination, which is foundational to the GenRL framework.

references.paper_title: Mastering diverse domains through world models
references.reason: This paper extends the work on model-based RL in imagination to a wider range of tasks and environments, directly informing the GenRL approach.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is a crucial component of GenRL, providing a way to connect visual and language representations.

references.paper_title: InternVideo2: Scaling video foundation models for multimodal video understanding
references.reason: InternVideo2 is a key foundation model utilized in GenRL, enabling the processing of video data and bridging the visual and language modalities.

references.paper_title: On the opportunities and risks of foundation models
references.reason: This paper provides a broad overview of foundation models, establishing the context and importance of GenRL in the field of embodied AI.
